message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI 

The paper proposes a method for learning a dissimilarity function for $k$-NN classification, which is a common problem in machine learning. The method is evaluated on large document and image datasets, indicating relevance to sub-categories such as cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.CV (Computer Vision), and cs.CL (Computation and Language). The method also involves solving a regression problem, which is a common technique in the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper mentions a theoretical justification in terms of reducing hubness in data, which is a concept relevant to the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
